channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves, 3rd August
item.description:
There are some leaves that probably need clearing before the block the drains

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Mill Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full litter/dog waste bin at start to footpath in Magpie Hall Lane, 3rd August
item.description:
The litter/dog waste bin is full and smelly. On verge off pavement at start of footpath in Magpie Hall Lane. Can this tall bin emptied. It fills quickly due to "recycling site" across road is full and now being used as rubbish dump. It should be recorded as needing to be emptied every week. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bench cushion on the sidewalk, 3rd August
item.description:
A piece of bench has been left on the sidewalk footpath at 2a Kirkham Street, SE18 2JU. It has screws so could be dangerous to pedestrians when passing by.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirkham Street, Plumstead, London

item.title: Bin obstructing the pavement, 3rd August
item.description:
This bin has been on the pavement for long time and is obstructing wheelchair and pushchair user tried to speak with tenants but they wont care removing it. Please can you ask then to remove from public way . Their address 65 Aldeburgh Street , flat 1 and 2 , SE10 0RW

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Horn Lane, East Greenwich, London

item.title: East Dulwich tavern bins on spurling road have not been emptied for 2 weeks., 3rd August
item.description:
The bins belonging to the pub are not being emptied . The rubbish is strewn all over the pavement. A complete eyesore, tripping hazard and health and safety concern due to vermin. Spurling Road has been blocked off on the entrance to Goose Green roundabout due to gas works for past 2 weeks and is expected to stay closed for 4 weeks. The rubbish collectors who collect from the pub are obviously not coming along the road as they would then have to reverse all the way out again. Please can this be dealt with as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox on small footpath lying in gap in hedge, 3rd August
item.description:
Park end of Whitebeam Ave. Walk down main footpath but not through metal barrier. As you walk you will see signage that points to small pathway on the L/H side off main path. A few yards along a gap in hedge you will see the dead fox on R/H side. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
